events.title: Australia-US minerals deal underpinned decision to allow Alcoa to keep clearing WA forest, document reveals
events.description: Document also shows US miner had been unlawfully clearing land for 15 years despite warnings from department Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The Australian governmentâ€™s decision to allow the US mining giant Alcoa to continue clearing swathes of Western Australian jarrah forest despite past illegal clearing practices was made in part due to a critical minerals deal reached between Australia and the Trump administration last year, a new document shows. The document also reveals Alcoa was unlawfully clearing land for its bauxite mining practices in the area south of Perth for 15 years, despite warnings from the federal environment department. Conservationists have expressed outrage that an â€œunprecedentedâ€ $55m penalty announced by the environment minister was only applied to a six-year period in which the illegal clearing was alleged to have occurred. Murray Watt said on Wednesday that the penalty â€“ known as an enforceable undertaking â€“ was for clearing that occurred from 2019-2025 in known habitat for nationally protected species without an approval under the Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation (EPBC) Act. When announcing the penalty, Watt said he had granted Alcoa a national interest exemption to allow it to continue clearing in the northern jarrah forest for 18 months while the government considered a proposal for an expansion of the companyâ€™s Huntly and Willowdale mining operations to 2045 . Continue reading...

events.title: "It really does put a big limit on his negotiating power"
events.description: After the U.S. Supreme Court struck down his sweeping global tariffs in a 6-3 ruling, President Trump denounced the decision as a "disgrace to our nation" and called the justices in the majority "very unpatriotic and disloyal to the Constitution," suggesting they had been "swayed by foreign interests." Undeterred, Trump quickly announced a new 10% global tariff, this time invoking a different trade law. The move potentially sets him on a collision course with Congress. On the question of refunds for tariffs already collected, estimated at up to $175 billion, the court's ruling was silent, leaving that question unresolved. Trump warned the process could be prolonged, saying the U.S. may be tied up in litigation for years.

events.description: President Trump hosted the first ever Board of Peace meeting Thursday in Washington, D.C., with about 40 countries attending.

events.title: Morning news brief
events.description: A second U.S. aircraft carrier moved closer to the Middle East Thursday, President Trump's Board of Peace held its first meeting, former Prince Andrew released after spending day in police custody.

events.title: Ethiopia faces renewed strain with Tigray and Eritrea
events.description: Across the northern Tigray region, citizens are bearing the burden of political fractures and rising tensions. Diplomats are urging restraint amid a troop buildup along the borders with Tigray and neighboring Eritrea.

events.title: Belarus opposition figure urges EU dialogue with Lukashenko
events.description: Maria Kolesnikova called on European leaders to reopen diplomatic channels with Alexander Lukashenko. She said such a move seemed the only way to ease the plight of political prisoners and their families.

events.title: Berlinale: African films brings messages of peace and tolerance
events.description: From migration to queer identity and ancestral mythology, African filmmakers came to the Berlinale with bold stories confronting repression and celebrating resistance.

events.title: Germany: Unreliable childcare forces parents into part-time
events.description: Chancellor Merz has been calling on Germans to work more. This is practically impossible for many working parents as childcare centers battle with staff shortages and reduced operating hours.

events.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Lasting impressions
events.description: Milano Cortina will be remembered for the performances of a Norwegian superstar and a Ukrainian skeleton racer's "helmet of remembrance."

events.title: China overtakes US to become Germany's top trading partner
events.description: China replaces US as Germany's top trading partner, reclaiming a position it held from 2016 to 2023. German Chancellor Friedrich Merz is set to visit China next week.
events.ticker_label: ğŸ’¥ China overtakes US to become Germany's top trading partner

events.title: Germans approve of democracy, but say it doesn't work well
events.description: Democracy is indispensable, according to most respondents to the new "Germany Monitor 2025" survey. However, many say it is functioning less well than in the past, and rapid change is causing great uncertainty.

events.title: India's AI governance push takes center stage at summit
events.description: The summit's emphasis on responsible use of artificial intelligence comes as India is still working out how that responsibility will be enforced at home.

events.title: Nearly 2 million highly educated Germans at risk of poverty
events.description: The figures indicate that although more people earned advanced qualifications, many did not secure well-paid jobs.

events.title: Germany news: CDU re-elects Chancellor Merz as party leader
events.description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz accused the far-right AfD of only serving its "own interests" during a CDU party conference speech. Former Chancellor Angela Merkel was welcomed as a special guest at the Stuttgart event.
events.ticker_label: ğŸ’¥ Germany news: CDU re-elects Chancellor Merz as party leader

events.title: SUDAN: Interview with Darfur's governor
events.description: In tonight's programme, tensions escalate between Ethiopia and Tigray. Also, Dafur's Governor Minni Arko Minawi discusses the latest developments in Sudan. And finally, after 110 years in French hands, the legendary talking drum, the Djidji AyÃ´kwÃª of the Atchan people, is finally being restituted to Ivory Coast.

events.title: France repatriates stolen colonial-era 'talking drum' to Ivory Coast
events.description: In the latest repatriation of stolen artefacts, France on Friday handed over the Djidji Ayokwe or "talking" drum back to Ivory Coast after it was looted by colonial troops in 1916. The drum, which was used by the Ebrie tribe to transmit messages, is one of hundreds of objects France is preparing to send back to Africa.

events.title: Police search former Prince Andrew's home a day after his arrest
events.description: John Curtice, Professor of Politics, is our guest.

events.title: Board-of-Peace : Trump says members have pledged $7bn to Gaza relief
events.description: Sinan Ciddi, expert on Turkish domestic politics and foreign policy, is our guest.

events.title: First human mission to the moon in 50 years set to blast off next month
events.description: NASA is planning to send astronauts to the moon next month for the first time in more than half a century.

events.title: Undercover police go dancing in lion costume to catch serial burglar
events.description: Thai police went undercover in a traditional lion costume in order to get close enough to a serial burglar to pounce on them and arrest them.

events.title: Barcelona's Sagrada Familia reaches maximum height as cross is placed on Tower of Jesus Christ
events.description: Barcelona's soaring Sagrada Familia basilica reached its maximum height on Friday, as a crane placed the upper arm of a cross atop the Tower of Jesus Christ.

events.description: Giant tortoises have returned to Floreana Island in Ecuador's Galapagos archipelago as conservationists release 158 juvenile hybrids to restore the ecosystem

events.title: Poland withdraws from treaty banning antipersonnel mines
events.description: Poland has officially left the Ottawa Convention, which bans the use of antipersonnel mines

events.title: Ex-South Korean president remains defiant following life sentence for rebellion
events.description: Ousted South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol on Friday remained defiant in his first reaction to a life sentence imposed by a Seoul court for his short-lived declaration of martial law but didnâ€™t clearly say whether he would appeal

events.title: Grain ATMs and hunger maps: AI innovations spotlighted at UN agency showcase in India
events.description: Artificial intelligence solutions that transform the way food assistance reaches people facing hunger were on display during an exhibition at an AI meeting this week in New Delhi, India.

events.title: High school teacher arrested in alleged sex case involving student
events.description: Georgia teacher Danielle Weaver, 29, is charged with child molestation after allegations of inappropriate contact with a student at Lee County High School.

events.title: Viral video shows anti-ICE school walkout teens invading Kroger, hurling objects: 'Ought to be prosecuted'
events.description: An Anti-ICE walkout at a Cincinnati high school led to teens invading a Kroger store and vandalizing property. Students ran through aisles and threw objects.

events.title: 6 mothers who 'cherished time together' among victims in avalanche near Lake Tahoe
events.description: Six of the eight victims in an avalanche in Sierra Nevada near Lake Tahoe have been identified as outdoor-loving mothers and seasoned skiers who regularly traveled together.

events.title: Truck smashes into famed synagogue, police charge man with hate crime: 'Very distressing'
events.description: A man is charged with a hate crime after allegedly ramming a truck into the Brisbane Synagogue gates. The 32-year-old faces multiple charges including vilification.

events.description: U.S. Southern Command leader makes visit to Venezuela after NicolÃ¡s Maduro's capture, meeting with interim leaders in Caracas to discuss security cooperation.
